title: Drawing, Screen Design:  "Voodoo for Peace," Reverse Side, ca. 1984
title_raw: Screen Design:  "Voodoo for Peace," Reverse Side
medium: Red and black marking pen; white and red color pencil (?), brush and white gouache (?) on tracing paper
description: Four panel screen in form of four figures whose heads and torsos are black and skirts are red with black polka dots.  Each figure is differentiated by the combination of geometric shapes and individual headdresses.  Reading from left to right:  figure with large circular head with arrow on top and diamond cutout on torso; figure with crown and tiny square cutout in head; figure with headdress of two cans and three diamond cutouts on torso; figure with elliptical head and four horizontal slits on torso.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Screen Design:  "Voodoo for Peace," Reverse Side, ca. 1984. Red and black marking pen; white and red color pencil (?), brush and white gouache (?) on tracing paper. 
Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-112
